result.execSummary:
Samuel L. Turner was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Samuel L. Turner was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel L. Turner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samuel L. Turner appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises Mr. Turner does not want counsel for today's hearing, only appearing to witness the waiver of extradition.  Court examines defendant on waiver, defendant signs waiver witnessed by Corporal Gahan and Atty Alme Boaz.  Court accepts waiver.
Emailed request from Atty Nadya Perez-Reyes for hearing to be held sooner than 6/15/15. Clerk set for 5/22/15 at 1:15pm for status.

Defendant Samuel Turner appears in person,  in custody of Ozaukee County Jail. Jeffrey Sisley appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court officer sworn and signs fugitive complaint. Court signs fugitive warrant. Defendant states his date of birth is 7/31/87 and his correct name is Sammy not Samuel. Defendant provided copies of fugitive complaint and warrant. Court reads complaint outloud. Defendant does not waive extradition and requests time to contact public defender.  State requesting $25,000.00 bail. Court so orders. Court sets matter out 30 days for Governor's warrant to be completed.

Defendant appears in custody of Ozaukee County Jail. Jeffrey Sisley appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court officer sworn and signs complaint. Defendant states his date of birth is 7/31/87 and his correct name is Sammy not Samuel. Defendant provided copies of fugitive complaint and warrant. Court reads complaint outloud. Defendant has not made contact with public defender by may do so in the future. Defendant wishes to speak with public defender's office. State requesting $25,000.00 bail.
Fugitive Complaint filed with  Fugitive Warrant
